programme.desc: A profile of the North American country, an ancient land full of diversity and mystery, and home to a vast wilderness of oceans, deserts, jungle and unique creatures

programme.title: Project Grizzly
programme.desc: Jeff Watson teaches his grizzlies to forage in the wild, but when Bob slashes him in the arm he is forced to reconsider the difficulty of them leaving the nest

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Kristie Franks has a difficult job trying to catch 20 cats in an over-run house, while Debbie Michielson rescues a horse with an injured leg

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: Robert wrangles western diamondback rattlesnakes in Arizona for the first time using his fathers techniques. Terri helps save some baby feathertail gliders

programme.desc: Tia is in Detroit helping a rescue facility at risk of closure. Villalobos looks for a stray pit bull nearby and a grieving adopter wants a dog to heal her heart

programme.title: The Zoo: San Diego
programme.desc: When lesser flamingo eggs and chicks are being preyed upon, the team must make a nerve-wracking decision. Plus, a wallaby and her joey become ambassador animals

programme.title: The Zoo: San Diego
programme.desc: After taking over the former red river hog habitat, a gazelle gives the team a big surprise. Staff race to prepare a den when they suspect the Amur leopard is pregnant

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: Texas Game Wardens Henson and Harper investigate a deer poaching case in which a confession from a suspect reveals the killing of more than 40 deer

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: A beloved poodle is rushed into surgery, Dr Jeff heads out to operate on an alligator, and four turtles, unable to eat, get their first vet visit in 43 years

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete Nelson designs a beehive-style structure for couple Donald and Alison Farmer. The small space includes shelving, soft seating and hexagonal, honeycomb-inspired features

programme.title: Guardians of the Glades
programme.desc: Dusty and his team come across a frightening new hybrid Python species when they trek deep into the dense Python Pines

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Otto, Eivin and August scramble to stake a claim on ten tons of steel on a distant beach. Meanwhile, Shane and Kelli break ground on their cabin

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: A hungry bear breaks into Noahs tent and terrifies the livestock. Later, the windmill assembly takes the siblings to dangerous new heights

programme.title: Live Snooker: UK Championship
programme.desc: Seema Jaswal presents coverage of the evening session on day three at York Barbican, featuring two first-round matches, played over the best of 11 frames. In last years corresponding session, Jak Jones fought back from 5-3 down to edge past 2023 world champion Luca Brecel 6-5. In contrast, the other match of the session saw Michael Holt comfortably defeat Gary Wilson 6-1, to reach the last 16 of the tournament for the first time since the 1999 event. With commentary and analysis from Steve Davis, John Parrott, Ken Doherty, Dennis Taylor and Stephen Hendry, and reports from Shabnam Younus-Jewell

programme.title: Saving Venice
programme.desc: Documentary exploring how Venetians are turning to revolutionary engineering, restoration of the natural environment and knowledge from their past in order to save their city from the impact of climate change

programme.title: Ian Rankins Hidden Edinburgh
programme.desc: Edinburgh is often described as the Athens of the North, but John Rebus, one its most famous detectives, views Scotlands capital in quite a different light - it is a crime scene waiting to happen. In this programme, Rebuss creator Ian Rankin revisits the key locations from the books. From the citys pubic triangle and the home of Scotlands most infamous madam to a police station where Rankin was interviewed about a real murder, the award-winning crime writer explores the hidden Edinburgh into which tourists never venture

programme.title: Wainwright: The Man Who Loved the Lakes
programme.desc: Part-dramatised profile of writer and artist Alfred Wainwright, the enthusiastic fell-walker from Blackburn who became renowned for his pictorial guides to the English Lake District. More than two million copies have been sold since he began writing them in 1955, and they have become the standard reference work for the area

programme.title: Saving Venice
programme.desc: Documentary exploring how Venetians are turning to revolutionary engineering, restoration of the natural environment and knowledge from their past in order to save their city from the impact of climate change

programme.title: Ian Rankins Hidden Edinburgh
programme.desc: Edinburgh is often described as the Athens of the North, but John Rebus, one its most famous detectives, views Scotlands capital in quite a different light - it is a crime scene waiting to happen. In this programme, Rebuss creator Ian Rankin revisits the key locations from the books. From the citys pubic triangle and the home of Scotlands most infamous madam to a police station where Rankin was interviewed about a real murder, the award-winning crime writer explores the hidden Edinburgh into which tourists never venture

programme.title: Live Snooker: UK Championship
programme.desc: Seema Jaswal presents coverage of the evening session on day four at York Barbican, featuring the concluding two first-round matches, played over the best of 11 frames. At this stage last year, Zhang Anda won six of the last seven frames against Lei Peifan to secure a 6-3 victory, scoring a maximum 147 break in the process. In the sessions over contest, Stuart Bingham fought back from 5-2 down against two-time champion Mark Williams to prevail 6-5. With commentary and analysis from Steve Davis, John Parrott, Ken Doherty, Dennis Taylor and Stephen Hendry, and reports from Shabnam Younus-Jewell

programme.title: The Hidden Children of Ruinerwold Farm
programme.desc: In 2019, the Dutch village of Ruinerwold became world news when a hidden family were discovered on a local farm, where six adult children had been kept in seclusion and abused by their father Gerrit-Jan Van Dorsten, a self-proclaimed prophet. Now 24-year-old Israel is reunited with his older brothers Shin and Edino and sister Mar Jan to recount their experiences growing up in the dark shadow of their fathers beliefs

programme.title: The Hidden Children of Ruinerwold Farm
programme.desc: Allegations of physical and sexual abuse come under discussion and three of the older children decide to visit their father, who is in a secure hospital following a stroke. First broadcast 24 October 2023

programme.title: Britains Outlaws: Highwaymen, Pirates and Rogues
programme.desc: Sam Willis concludes his exploration of the criminal underworld of the 17th and 18th centuries by looking at urban crime, fraud and corruption, uncovering a fascinating rogues gallery of villains. He examines the case of thief and serial escaper Jack Sheppard, who was so notorious that almost a quarter of a million people turned up to witness his hanging, while fraudster Mary Toft managed to convince George Is surgeon that she had given birth to rabbits

programme.title: The Brits Who Designed the Modern World
programme.desc: Arts reporter Brenda Emmanus marks the opening of Kensingtons new Design Museum this month by profiling 10 of the most celebrated living British designers, whose work has revolutionised the nations homes, streets and culture since the Second World War. Among those whose careers are highlighted are road-sign designer Margaret Calvert, ZX Spectrum creator Rick Dickinson, Andrew Ritchie, who gave the world the Brompton Bike, and Kenneth Grange, who designed everything from British Rails distinctive InterCity 125 to Kenwood food mixers. A panel of contributors including Will.i.am, Jeremy Paxman, Pete Waterman and Ade Adepitan explain how their lives have benefited from British designs

programme.title: Wainwright: The Man Who Loved the Lakes
programme.desc: Part-dramatised profile of writer and artist Alfred Wainwright, the enthusiastic fell-walker from Blackburn who became renowned for his pictorial guides to the English Lake District. More than two million copies have been sold since he began writing them in 1955, and they have become the standard reference work for the area

programme.title: Britains Outlaws: Highwaymen, Pirates and Rogues
programme.desc: Sam Willis concludes his exploration of the criminal underworld of the 17th and 18th centuries by looking at urban crime, fraud and corruption, uncovering a fascinating rogues gallery of villains. He examines the case of thief and serial escaper Jack Sheppard, who was so notorious that almost a quarter of a million people turned up to witness his hanging, while fraudster Mary Toft managed to convince George Is surgeon that she had given birth to rabbits

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and Louise Minchin present the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.sub-title: Tainted Tap Water Left us in Agony
programme.desc: Louise Minchin, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville seek answers for homeowners who say their water company should have acted faster when a dangerous cryptosporidium bug was found in their tap water supply. Customers of a double glazing firm claim theyve been left out in the cold and one well-known supermarket are having trouble with reward points being stolen

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin and Tommy Walsh track the progress on the renovations of a back to front house in Eastbourne and two derelict properties in Grimsby and Worcestershire

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp meets a lady who has spent 30 years repairing well-worn teddy bears. Meanwhile, experts Phil Serrell and Roo Irvine lead their teams at an antiques fair in Southwell

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC Newsline; Weather
programme.desc: Local news worth watching from across Northern Ireland

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Marvellous Miniature Workshop
programme.desc: Sara Cox presents as a team of expert model-makers bring cherished places from the past back to life in miniature. The first episode features Manchesters now-derelict Crumpsall Library, which is recreated for Leah, a retired social worker who met her late husband there as a teenager

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Having spent several years trying to earn a living from pyrography, Chantal feels its her last chance to make her craft pay. After having to give up her sugar-craft shop following a 33-year career, Claire needs to find a new way of earning a living and has her sights set on a new stained-glass business to pay the bills. They both seek advice on how to turn their hobbies into viable careers from Dom Chinea and his team of experts and then have two months to take on board all the tips offered to turn their passions into paying professions

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley helps a London buyer find her dream home in the Dorset countryside and also meets a family who have turned local fish canning into a coastal success story

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.sub-title: Taylor Pressure Helmet, Industrial Trolley, Art Nouveau Stands
programme.desc: The dealers welcome Scott and Clare from Aberdare, Georges loses his head over a super-rare pilots helmet, and Wallys normal-sized Mini poster proves a huge hit

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Bee Harford makes her debut alongside Raj Bisram in Dorset, where they put their money on a piece of horseshoe-shaped silver, a bit of carved black forest and an equestrian boot

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Stephen Mangan

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: When a widow is assaulted, she gives the police a description of her attackers, though something about her account doesnt ring true. Frustrated by her suspension, Sasha takes out her angst on her ex, Donal. When Marlene tries to talk to Sasha about the kiss they shared, Sasha admits that shes in love with someone else. Clint is devastated when he discovers that his wife Nicole has gone behind his back, while Eve is convinced that somethings going on between her husband Luke and his ex-girlfriend. When Eve and Clint find themselves alone, they begin to see each other in a whole new light

programme.title: If Walls Could Talk
programme.desc: Newry Town Hall has been a site of protest and performance for over a century. From civil rights meetings to pantomimes, punk gigs to same-sex marriages, this beloved building has played a central role in the cultural and social life of the community

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: As the Slaters prepare for Freddie and Annas goodbye celebrations, relations are fraught between Jean and the family. Howie makes a life-changing decision, Lauren moots the idea of having Jimmy christened, and Harry takes Nicolas credit card on false pretences to buy drugs

programme.title: Panorama
programme.sub-title: The Truth About Forever Chemicals - Panorama
programme.desc: Catrin Nye investigates the hidden dangers of PFAS, the so-called forever chemicals found in everyday items like waterproof coats and non-stick pans, as well as in food and water. With exclusive testing, personal stories, and expert interviews, Catrin reveals how these toxic substances can affect our health and contaminate the environment, and asks, if the UK Government is doing enough to keep us safe

programme.title: Prisoner 951
programme.desc: Nazanin is heartbroken when her daughter returns to the UK. Richard must learn to be a dad again and decides to go on hunger strike to get his wife home

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: Born in Belfast: A Hip Hop Story
programme.desc: The story of how hip hop rose from Belfasts streets to the global stage. Drawing on archive footage, live performances and candid interviews, the programme charts the evolution of Northern Irelands hip hop scene, from early pioneers like Jun Tzu to a new generation of global artists such as Kneecap and Jordan Adetunji

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade guests hosts, with writer and broadcaster Richard Osman and comedian Bella Hull joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop as they delve into the news. As usual, all concerned poke fun at the weeks headlines

programme.title: Dating Apps: The Inside Story
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the Match Group, the corporation behind some of the worlds biggest online dating apps, and revealing the duplicity at the heart of the matchmaking services on offer. Surveys consistently find the majority of users are seeking long-term and serious relationships. However, this programme reveals how they have been sold a lie, and are manipulated in the pursuit of profit

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Louise Minchin and Rav Wilding present the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Louise Minchin, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville investigate a telecoms firm making promises about contracts that business owners say it fails to keep. Plus, the homeowners who blame a trusted tradesperson website for putting them in touch with a cowboy builder who left them with a bill for tens of thousands of pounds, how criminals are spoofing email addresses to scam people and the robot vacuum cleaner that fell down the stairs

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Tommy Wash track the progress of renovations on two houses in London valued at over a million pounds each and a development in Huddersfield

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Charles Hanson and Caroline Hawley help two teams look for items in the Lancashire town of Eccleston. Eric Knowles oversees proceedings and also goes to the nearby town of Chorley to quiz locals on a miniature antique he has brought along

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Marvellous Miniature Workshop
programme.desc: Abi Trotman recreates a miniature version of a 1980s east London school classroom for restaurateur Kim, capturing memories of a beloved teacher and the first real sense of safety and belonging. Presented by Sara Cox

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: After leaving teaching, Clare turned to metalwork and retrained as a blacksmith. Having just finished her studies, she needs to start making money so that she and her partner can save up a deposit for their first home. Orchestra box office manager Gavin, who currently lives with his mother, wants his own place with more space for him and his equipment. They both seek advice on how to turn their hobbies into viable careers from Dom Chinea and his team of experts

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a couple move from Germany to the British countryside, as they search for their ideal home in either Herefordshire or Gloucestershire. He also meets a writer living her best life in the country

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers presents as dealers bid for a miniature sewing machine from the 1950s thats been in storage for more than 33 years, a canteen of silver cutlery, a wartime accordion, gingerbread moulds from the Netherlands and old accounts ledgers

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Raj Bisram and Briony Harford travel through Hampshire, where items that catch their eye include a fine piece of furniture and a rare document signed by none other than Louis XIV. They also take a detour to a historic steamship, once used to haul a rather unsavoury cargo, but now restored as a proud symbol of Britains maritime heritage

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Stephen Mangan

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Lauren Laverne present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Zoe has some difficult questions for a loved one, Anthony confronts Howie about his suspicions, Nicola tries to protect Harry, and Anna makes it her mission to build bridges between Kojo, Gina and Harry before she leaves

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: Singer Alfie Boe, ex-rugby union player Alun Wyn Jones, reality star Ashley Cain, Gladiator Jodie Ounsley and comedian Noreen Khan compete to secure a place in the last quarter-final. They start by lifting their cloche to reveal a random ingredient to use in their first dish, before a blindfold test in which they must identify cubes of meat, fish or fruit by touch and taste only. Finally, they have one hour to cook a dish they would be proud to serve on their own food stall

programme.title: Whats the Monarchy For?
programme.desc: With recent events having put the royal family under the spotlight, David Dimbleby probes politicians and insiders on fundamental questions about the institution at the heart of the nation. He begins by questioning how much power and influence the monarch really has. It is said that kings and queens should be politically neutral but is that true? And in a world where political leaders are continually under attack, what role is there for an unelected head of state? Contributors include David Cameron and Jacob Rees-Mogg

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: Spotlight
programme.desc: Investigations into social and political issues affecting Northern Ireland

programme.title: Tommy: The Good. The Bad. The Fury
programme.desc: After the success of his comeback fight, Tommys road to redemption hits a major setback - his hand is injured again and needs eight weeks total rest before doctors will know if he can fight again. The last time he couldnt train, his life spiralled out of control, so now Tommy throws himself into a frenzy of activity - a TV appearance on The Wheel, family days out with Bambi and a final push to finish the home he hopes Molly and Bambi will soon return to

programme.title: Tommy: The Good. The Bad. The Fury
programme.desc: Tommys recovery is back on track after he and John put his hand to the test. The pair are training again, and the search for Tommys next opponent begins. Eager to make the most of family time, Tommy splashes out on a £90,000 motor home for family trips with Molly and Bambi and takes his mother out for lunch and a long-overdue catch-up. Tommy reveals that John has had a recent health scare, so to cheer him up, father and son take their very different caravans to a local steam fair

programme.title: Lara Croft: Tomb Raider
programme.desc: The gun-toting treasure seeker is thrown into a furious battle with a mysterious secret society as she races against time to locate the missing pieces of a legendary artefact that grants the owner the ability to control time. Action adventure based on the video games, starring Angelina Jolie, Daniel Craig, Leslie Phillips, Iain Glen, Chris Barrie and Jon Voight

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Famous inmates, botched escapes and thefts, and Henry VIIIs favourite executions - theyre all here in a terrifying history of the Tower of London

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: From the Trojan Horse, to Jason and his Argonauts going to find the Golden Fleece, and Zeus going on historical first dates as an ant, Horrible Histories presents mythical mayhem, Greek style

programme.title: The Catch Up
programme.desc: A round-up of the days news

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May head to Norway to find out how a selection of cars fare when taking part in Winter Olympic events. Their experiments include firing a rocket-powered Mini off a ski jump, tackling the biathlon with 4x4s, staging a game of motorised ice hockey and timing the Jaguar XK in a speed-skating race

programme.title: Dating Apps: The Inside Story
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the Match Group, the corporation behind some of the worlds biggest online dating apps, and revealing the duplicity at the heart of the matchmaking services on offer. Surveys consistently find the majority of users are seeking long-term and serious relationships. However, this programme reveals how they have been sold a lie, and are manipulated in the pursuit of profit

programme.title: Fake Friend: The Ticket Scammer
programme.desc: The case of a Somerset high-flyer who turned his charm and connections into tools of deception, conning his friends and hundreds of others, while living a life of glamour himself. Through the voices of his victims and event industry insiders, this documentary uncovers the high personal and financial cost of chasing exclusivity, and how easily even the most cautious can be deceived

programme.title: Ashley Cain: Into the Danger Zone
programme.desc: The former footballer visits some of the worlds most dangerous cities to explore the issues that affect young men born into a life on the fringes of society. He begins in the favelas of Rio, Brazil, where he learns what it takes to become a lookout, foot soldier and drug dealer in a world where death could become reality at any moment. He also comes face-to-face with a gun-toting militia boss to uncover how these men rule through fear and intimidation

programme.title: Ashley Cain: Into the Danger Zone
programme.desc: South Africa has for years battled the scourge of rhino poaching, fuelled by insatiable demand for their horns in Asia. Ashley embarks on a mission to find out who is behind these acts, discovering how the challenges young men face growing up in deprived rural communities can lead them into poaching

programme.title: Confessions of a Teenage Fraudster
programme.desc: How a 16-year-old used his job in a call centre in Glasgow to go on a five-year crime wave, defrauding innocent cardholders and laying the groundwork for a life of wealth, first-class travel and an escape from the life he was destined for

programme.title: Confessions of a Teenage Fraudster
programme.desc: Between the ages of 17 and 21, Elliot Castro managed to commit fraudulent activity amounting to a estimated £2 million. This documentary continues his story. With a trail of crime stretching across several continents as he continued to live life on the run, then 18-year-old Elliot became more paranoid than ever and a stint in foreign jail seemed just around the corner

programme.title: Confessions of a Teenage Fraudster
programme.desc: After four years travelling the world spending fraudulently accrued money, it seems inevitable that Elliot will be deported into the hands of British police, who have put together an extensive case of his crimes. Once again though, he has other ideas. In truth, the one thing Elliot desires as much as freedom is a settled life. But even when he thinks hes found it, with a new home and friends, there is no escape from his trail of lies and deception. Eventually, justice seems set to catch up with him

programme.title: The Kim Kardashian Diamond Heist
programme.desc: The inside story of the 2016 robbery and its impact, with those close to the case revealing details about the crime for the first time. Featuring interviews with friends of the family, police officers and journalists who have followed the case, this documentary recalls the fateful night when the US reality TV star was robbed of millions of dollars worth of jewellery in Paris at gunpoint

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Everything from roads to baths to pies, hosts Emperor Nero and warrior queen Boudicca are here to show what the Romans did while they were here in Britain

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Grisly tales of the Civil War, one of the weirdest, wildest periods in English history, featuring the only time that a king has been tried and executed for treason

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May travel to America for an interstate road trip, completing various challenges along the way. Starting in Miami, they each buy a car for less than $1,000 and drive to New Orleans, where they set out to give their vehicles away to people who suffered in Hurricane Katrina

programme.title: Tommy: The Good. The Bad. The Fury
programme.desc: After the success of his comeback fight, Tommys road to redemption hits a major setback - his hand is injured again and needs eight weeks total rest before doctors will know if he can fight again. The last time he couldnt train, his life spiralled out of control, so now Tommy throws himself into a frenzy of activity - a TV appearance on The Wheel, family days out with Bambi and a final push to finish the home he hopes Molly and Bambi will soon return to

programme.title: Tommy: The Good. The Bad. The Fury
programme.desc: Tommys recovery is back on track after he and John put his hand to the test. The pair are training again, and the search for Tommys next opponent begins. Eager to make the most of family time, Tommy splashes out on a £90,000 motor home for family trips with Molly and Bambi and takes his mother out for lunch and a long-overdue catch-up. Tommy reveals that John has had a recent health scare, so to cheer him up, father and son take their very different caravans to a local steam fair

programme.title: Dating Apps: The Inside Story
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the Match Group, the corporation behind some of the worlds biggest online dating apps, and revealing the duplicity at the heart of the matchmaking services on offer. Surveys consistently find the majority of users are seeking long-term and serious relationships. However, this programme reveals how they have been sold a lie, and are manipulated in the pursuit of profit

programme.title: Ashley Cain: Into the Danger Zone
programme.desc: Frances second-largest city Marseille has been the nations drug capital for over 50 years, but the violence of its drug war is escalating, as rival gangs kidnap, torture, kill and even set one another on fire. Ashley spends time in the notorious northern suburbs known as the cites, meeting young men involved in fighting the bloody drug war as well as riding along with the police on a night-time patrol

programme.title: Ashley Cain: Into the Danger Zone
programme.desc: The former footballer heads deep into the Colombian jungle to find out why gold is now twice as valuable than cocaine to the countrys organised crime groups, meeting the young men drawn into this illegal venture, discovering the shocking health impact mining is having on them, as well as meeting the cartel gangsters who control almost every element of life in these remote regions

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May head to Norway to find out how a selection of cars fare when taking part in Winter Olympic events. Their experiments include firing a rocket-powered Mini off a ski jump, tackling the biathlon with 4x4s, staging a game of motorised ice hockey and timing the Jaguar XK in a speed-skating race

programme.desc: Because he has won the moss-ball game last year, Puff is in charge of organizing this Summer’s Picnic. Only Puff isn’t comfortable in that role. / Mush-Mush, Chep and Lilit notice that Mushpie seems in great shape lately. They want to feel as great as she does and try to discover her secret. / When Chep asks Mush-Mush and Lilit to go storm-watching and they refuse, Lilit feels bad and convinces Mush-Mush to join their friend. / Fung and Miff have come across a rare piece of bark struck by lightning.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: Special Delivery/The Perfect Fritter/The Art of Friendship/What a Stinker
programme.desc: Chep knows so many things about nature that Mush-Mush and Lilit are confident he’s not far from being an expert like Mushpot. / Sushi-Mushi tests new compost fritters recipes. When Mush-Mush gets to taste one, he can’t believe it: Sushi-Mushi has cooked the perfect fritter. / When Chanterelle sees how good Lilit is at painting, she offers to help her dig into her talent. / Chep is very excited: tonight, a rare and extremely stinky plant is going to bloom! But he already promised Mush-Mush to play their favourite game.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: Mush-Mush The Predictor/Whos Eating Mushton/The Breathtaking Bolly Show/Work Like a Charm/Star Helpers/The Rollinator
programme.desc: Mush-Mush can’t figure out why his sense foot keeps buzzing like crazy… until an earthquake shakes the forest. Mush-Mush is sure he predicted it! / Everyone in Mushton is finding that their precious wooden things are being munched and destroyed by someone or something. / If Mush-Mush had Bolly’s speed, he’d want everyone to see just how awesomely fast he was. / Chep becomes obsessed with learning all about Mushlore – all the funny little traditions and things that Mushables believe in. / Starmush’s back is stuck, and the Mushelder has no choice but to ask for help in Mushton. / Chep is so good at moss-marbles, no one wants to play him anymore! No one except Sumush who reveals himself to be a tough competitor.

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.desc: ...Major/Bear Fractions/The Bear That Laid Golden Eggs/Crash Training Course/As Far as Bear Can Remember/Chemical Lemmings/Remote Control => As usual Grizzy picks the door of the Rangers log cabin to come in and make himself comfortable but this time its impossible to enter! / The Lemmings have got hold of beans with strange properties. / Grizzy wants to get rid of the old piano at any cost. / The Lemmings inherit a crate that fell off an army convoy. / The Lemmings want to get their hands on a firework rocket. / Grizzy finds a high-tech gadget that enables you to learn anything within seconds. He can now become the perfect bear! / An old metal box found by chance in a recess of a cliff brings back childhood memories for Grizzy and the Lemmings. / How can one peacefully watch a documentary on salmon, nice and comfy on the sofa, when the Lemmings are playing chemistry with a fun experiment box? / Grizzys TV remote is stolen and stored high up in a tree.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables

programme.desc: It’s Fool the Forest Day! Mushables pull pranks all over Mushton, and Mush-Mush has an epic one planned. / When ants invade Fung and Miff’s tree, our Mushlers offer for them to move in… but the two quickly turn out to be unbearable roommates. / Mush-Mush and his friends are determined to win the bark sledge race, but their essential fourth team member drops out. / Puff doesn’t like change much. And with spring about to burst forth and all the changes spring brings, he is puffing out nervous fog which is blanketing the whole of Mushton. / So Mushpie can take a break, Mush-Mush, Chep and Lilit offer to look after the Mushies, assuring her that everything will be fine.

programme.desc: Giovanna and Baby Bear welcome little ones Oakley, Arthur, Luna, Reau, Tylana and their grown-ups to The Baby Club. Parents, carers and their babies at home are invited to join in with all the fun activities too! Inside Giovannas bag is a toy camera, and all the parents and babies have different objects and toys that are themed around a day out. These are explored through discovery, play, song and story. Grown-ups at home are encouraged to take part by hiding safe, baby-appropriate toys and objects inside a fabric bag or pillowcase for them to reveal and explore with their baby! The fun song Looking Out on Our Day Out features, as does a story involving Baby Bear. Viewers at home show how theyve been exploring things that are themed around a day out too. The Together Song gets everyone moving about, before some calm time with sensory bubbles and the Goodbye Song.

Around 250,000 visitors are expected to flock to marvel at the breathtaking state rooms and sprawling grounds transformed into an unrecognisable winter wonderland. The palaces army of staff, volunteers and specialist teams have under three weeks to install seasonal cheer on a colossal scale

programme.desc: Comedy clips showcasing amusing internet videos on the themes of food and animals

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef tries to transform the fortunes of Sebastians, a pizzeria in Burbank, Los Angeles, which is failing to attract customers, leaving the owner in debt and struggling to support his family. Gordon is horrified to discover pre-processed and frozen ingredients on the menu, but there seems to be little he can do to help when he is thrown out of the kitchen

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Barry needs the money to buy an expensive new pair of basketball trainers, so Murray hires him to work at his furniture shop. Beverly refuses to let Adam see a new horror film, but he goes behind her back and tricks Pops into taking him to the cinema. Comedy, starring Wendi McLendon-Covey and Jeff Garlin

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Beverly tries to find Pops a person to settle down with, and sets him up on a date with a woman called Sophia who seems to fit his demanding criteria. Meanwhile, Adam and Barry bond over their discovery of a new TV channel. Comedy, starring Wendi McLendon-Covey and Jeff Garlin

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: After a failed Black Friday shopping spree, Marge is determined to fix Christmas, but Homer and the kids surprise Marge with a holiday at a Florida resort

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge and Homer leave Grampa to babysit the kids, but little green army men trigger a PTSD episode, sending the family on a journey to Abes past when he was a postwar toy model

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: After the repairs are completed in Amys flat, she lies to Sheldon by telling him that the work is still ongoing so they can carry on living together for a while longer. Leonard is upset when he finds out Penny has been moving his collectibles out of Sheldons old room and into storage behind his back

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon goes to great lengths to convince Amy that they should have a baby together after they successfully complete a scientific experiment using their DNA samples. Raj is too embarrassed to tell his friends what the new woman in his life does for a living

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Mitch reluctantly lets his distressed colleague Brenda stay the night, Phil and Claire think Alex has let her imagination run wild after she tells them she has a boyfriend, and Jay hits a Manny-shaped obstacle while trying to get out of accompanying Gloria to a party. Kirsten Johnston (3rd Rock from the Sun) guest stars, with Jesse Tyler Ferguson, Ty Burrell, Ed ONeill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Haley turns 21, so the adults hit a bar, where Claire is desperate to appear more of a pal than a nagging, uptight mum, and Cameron and Mitchell are distressed when their cool credentials come up short. Phil and Jays quick pitstop to buy a present takes a disastrous turn, too, while back at home, Alex, Manny and Luke are left to babysit Lily

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The friends fight over a ring they believe was used in the Lord of the Rings film trilogy. Leonard hopes to return the item to its rightful owner - but Raj wishes to sell it so he can buy a jet ski, and Sheldon develops a Gollum-like obsession with the precious object

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is awarded a prestigious prize by the university, but is scared of collecting the gong at a ceremony because he knows hell have to give a speech. Penny tries to gee him up with rousing references to X-Men, and Leonard and Raj offer psychological guidance - without much success

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard tells Penny he loves her, but fails to get the response he would have liked. Sheldon also finds himself competing against Star Trek: The Next Generation actor Wil Wheaton once again when the gang goes bowling - and tries to get his revenge

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon tries to hide the fact he had dinner with Penny after she broke up with Leonard, hoping to stay friends with her. However, keeping secrets does not prove to be his strong point, and it isnt long before his deceit is exposed. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons, Kaley Cuoco and Johnny Galecki

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: A High-Pitched Buzz and Training Wheels
programme.desc: The prodigy dismantles the refrigerator to stop it making an annoying humming noise and is then forced to get a paper round to pay for the repairs to the damaged appliance. Comedy spin-off prequel to The Big Bang Theory, starring Iain Armitage

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: A Rival Prodigy and Sir Isaac Neutron
programme.desc: Meemaw intervenes when Sheldon gets jealous of Dr Sturgis bonding with Paige, a rival 10-year-old genius. In the meantime, Mary invites Paiges family over for a play date

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The family goes on holiday to Niagara Falls, where a mix-up sees Lisa mistakenly granted asylum in Canada and Marge has to come to her daughters rescue

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Mr Burns cuts health care benefits for his employees, so Marge buys healing crystals to treat Barts ADD and decides to sell them to support her family when they appear to work

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon agrees to participate in a series of short lectures at the university, but is worried the students dislike him. Following Amys advice, he asks Penny to give him acting lessons to help him engage with his audience. Elsewhere, Raj fantasises about his best friends partner. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard is forced to consider how far he is willing to push himself in the name of science when a wealthy benefactor makes an indecent proposal. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, with Jessica Walter (Arrested Development) and Joshua Malina (The West Wing)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard is torn between his relationship with Bernadette and pleasing his mother - and comes up with a solution that leaves everyone unsatisfied. Leonard rekindles his romance with Rajs sister Priya, while Amy uses Pennys emotions as the basis for a research project

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon decides to make a new set of friends as he is depressed that the groups social world revolves around Leonard rather than himself. Meanwhile, Amy and Bernadette try to persuade Penny to go on a date. Comedy, guest starring LeVar Burton, with Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Mayim Bialik

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer begins to believe Ned Flanders may not be so bad after all, and starts hanging around with him - but his friendliness and good cheer are not reciprocated for long

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart wins a competition and becomes the lucky owner of a fully grown elephant, which proceeds to eat his hard-up family out of house and home

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Ste tries to do the right thing, but a text leads Lucas to jump to conclusions, a resident fights to keep the past hidden and Liberty tries to pull her family back together

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Krusty learns he has a long-lost daughter, but ruins any chances of a happy family life by gambling away her most prized possession in a high-stakes poker game. Featuring the guest voices of Drew Barrymore, John Updike, Amy Tam and Stephen King

programme.title: Americas Next Top Model
programme.desc: The four contestants remain in Morocco, where they meet Vogue Italia editor-in-chief Francesca Sozzani, before performing a tea-tray dance, which goes badly for Molly, but earns Brittani a catwalk lesson with Miss J. Her luck is not to last, however, as she falls ill after sampling local delicacies, including goats brain and eyeballs. For this weeks photoshoot, the girls model clothes by Brazilian designer Daniella Issa Helayel in the Medina street market

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: A round-up of memorable moments featured on the show over the course of 2022. The armchair critics, including the Siddiquis, Giles and Mary, Jenny and Lee, Ellie and Izzi, Marcus and Mica, Amira and Iqra and Roisin and Joe, share their opinions on Strictly Come Dancing, Im a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!, Ninja Warrior: Race for Glory, Coronation Street, Secret Crush, Frozen Planet II, BBC News coverage of the Queen lying in state, Heartstopper, This Morning, Britains Got Talent, Gordon Ramsays Future Food Stars, Sue Perkins: Perfectly Legal, Bad Sisters and Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Dina, 39, is keen to settle down and start a family, but her date, 41-year-old Stephen, is a born adventurer who has climbed the Matterhorn and swum oceans. Will he run a mile when she shares her intentions with him? Margaret, 73, hasnt been on a date for 44 years and is looking for a family man who shares her love of music and life, while art student Rachel, meets vegan singer-songwriter and self-confessed hippie Hari

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The guys invite the girls to a Dungeons and Dragons night when their trip to Vegas falls through after an incident with airport security. However, following a few drinks, Sheldon and Amys relationship takes an unexpected turn. Meanwhile, Raj goes on a date with Lucy, who tries to sneak out of the restaurants bathroom window - but ends up getting stuck and calling for his help

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard is offered an exciting job opportunity, but it will mean he has to leave the country for several months. Penny tries to support his ambitions, while Sheldon is jealous and attempts to discourage him from accepting the post. Meanwhile, Raja pushes the boundaries with Lucy, but puts their relationship in jeopardy

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 22-year-old gym addict Sophie from Surrey, who is desperate to find a man who boasts a little banter. Next up is Dom, a 25-year-old wedding model from Bournemouth. He wants to find the perfect man to waltz him down the aisle and thinks people that can guarantee to do this are confident, daring and adventurous in their outlook

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil thinks hes found the perfect present for Jays birthday. Meanwhile, a difficult encounter is on the cards for Andy and Haley. Starring Ed ONeill and Julie Bowen

programme.desc: Beverly is pitted against a rival mother when she tries to micro-manage Barry and Ericas search for college places, while Erica tells Pops that she has tried to enhance her prospects by lying about her extracurricular activities. programme.title: Carrington VC
programme.desc: A decorated Army major resorts to embezzling mess funds to make ends meet - an act that leaves him facing a court martial, with the evidence stacked against him. To make matters worse, his wife sees the opportunity to get revenge for his wartime affairs by providing false testimony for the prosecution. Courtroom drama, starring David Niven, Margaret Leighton, Noelle Middleton, Laurence Naismith and Clive Morton

programme.title: Pool of London
programme.desc: A sailor learns his involvement in smuggling has made him the chief suspect in a murder case, and reluctantly goes on the run. Ealing thriller, starring Bonar Colleano, Susan Shaw, Renee Asherson and James Robertson Justice

programme.title: The Fallen Idol
programme.desc: An ambassadors son idolises his fathers butler, and tries to throw the police off his scent when he is suspected of murder. However, the boys actions only make the servant seem more suspicious, and he begins to realise that his hero may have deceived him. Crime drama, starring Ralph Richardson and Bobby Henrey

programme.title: Fatherhood
programme.desc: A father brings up his baby girl as a single dad after the unexpected death of his wife who died a day after their daughters birth. Comedy drama, starring Kevin Hart and Alfre Woodard

programme.title: Central Intelligence
programme.desc: Action comedy, starring Dwayne Johnson as a one-time geek who suffered constant humiliation at high school but grew up to be a lethal CIA agent. But when he is targeted by his own organisation, he comes home for a high school reunion, where he enlists the help of the former campus tough guy - now a meek accountant - who very quickly wonders what he has got himself into. Co-starring Kevin Hart and Amy Ryan

programme.title: Violent Night
programme.desc: Santa Claus materialises down the chimney of greedy matriarch Gertrude Lightstone just as criminal mastermind Mr Scrooge storms the mansion on Christmas Eve with an army of goons to steal 300million US dollars from the Lightstone family vault. Action comedy, starring David Harbour, John Leguizamo, Beverly DAngelo and Alex Hassell

programme.title: S.W.A.T.
programme.desc: A cops career is seemingly over when he accidentally shoots a hostage while thwarting a bank robbery. He is given the chance to redeem himself by joining an elite unit headed by a veteran sergeant. Their mission is to escort an international crime lord in custody as he is taken to prison. However, they hit a snag when their prisoner offers a multimillion-dollar reward to anyone who breaks him out of jail, placing them under attack from every criminal in the city. Action thriller, starring Samuel L Jackson and Colin Farrell

programme.title: Mothering Sunday
programme.desc: A maid living in post-First World War England secretly plans to meet with the man she loves while her employers are away, seizing a last chance to be together before he leaves to marry another woman. Romantic drama, starring Odessa Young, Josh OConnor, Colin Firth and Olivia Colman

programme.title: Arizona Raiders
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the American Civil War, two Confederate soldiers are offered a way out of jail. Their former comrades-in-arms are now a gang of bandits terrorising Arizona, and the two prisoners are sent to infiltrate the group and bring them to justice. Western, starring Audie Murphy, Buster Crabbe, Ben Cooper and Gloria Talbott

programme.title: Cover Girl
programme.desc: Dancer Rusty Parker works in a small New York club with her choreographer boyfriend Danny McGuire, but gets a taste of fame when she wins a competition to appear on the cover of a prestigious magazine. This in turn leads to her starring in hit musical, though her success has a dramatic effect on her relationship with Danny. Musical comedy, starring Rita Hayworth and Gene Kelly

programme.title: Gift Horse
programme.desc: A Navy captain reluctantly takes command of an old US destroyer during the Second World War and struggles with a crew who do not respect his authority. However, the prospect of facing the mighty German force brings much-needed unity. Adventure, starring Trevor Howard, Richard Attenborough, Bernard Lee, Sonny Tufts and James Donald

programme.title: The Moonraker
programme.desc: A foppish royalist nobleman leads a double life as a Roundhead-baiting highwayman. However, after Cromwells final victory at the battle of Worcester, the dashing hero has to smuggle the son of Charles I to safety in France. Swashbuckling adventure, starring George Baker, Sylvia Syms, Marius Goring, John Le Mesurier and Patrick Troughton

programme.title: Instant Family
programme.desc: After being taunted by relatives who think they will never have kids, married couple Pete and Ellie Wagner consider the option of adopting a child. However, they get more than they bargained for when they take in a rebellious teen and her two siblings. Director Sean Anders comedy, starring Mark Wahlberg, Rose Byrne and Isabela Merced

programme.title: Transporter 2
programme.desc: A retired former special forces agent has the job of chauffeuring the son of a controversial Miami politician. When Russian criminals kidnap the youngster and inject him with a virus in the hope of infecting his father, the driver sets out to find the boy and his abductors. Action thriller sequel, starring Jason Statham, Alessandro Gassman and Amber Valletta

programme.title: Inglourious Basterds
programme.desc: American officer Aldo Raine leads a squad of soldiers into occupied France on a mission to kill as many Nazis as possible and spread fear through the Third Reich. They become involved in a Jewish resistance fighters plan to blow up the premiere of a propaganda movie - due to be attended by Hitler himself. Quentin Tarantinos wartime adventure, with Brad Pitt, Melanie Laurent, Diane Kruger, Michael Fassbender and an Oscar-winning Christoph Waltz

programme.title: A Private Function
programme.desc: In post-war Yorkshire, with rationing still very much in force, a mild-mannered chiropodist tries to prove his worth to the snobbish locals by kidnapping a pig which is being fattened up for a local banquet. Alan Bennetts comedy, starring Michael Palin, Maggie Smith, Denholm Elliott, Alison Steadman and Liz Smith

programme.title: Lone Rider
programme.desc: A veteran of the American Civil War returns to his home town to discover a former friend, who has become a ruthless land baron, is intent on seizing his fathers ranch, forcing the hardened soldier to take up arms once more to protect his family and their property. Western, starring Lou Diamond Phillips, Vincent Spano and Stacy Keach

programme.title: The High Chaparral
programme.desc: A recently widowed woman takes an interest in Buck, and stirs up tension between him and John

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: A wealthy Texan hires four mercenaries to rescue his wife, who has been abducted and taken to Mexico by a bandit gang. However, when they find her, she refuses to leave and they have to take her by force - ending in a cross-border chase with the outlaws on their trail. Western adventure, with Burt Lancaster, Lee Marvin, Robert Ryan, Woody Strode, Jack Palance and Claudia Cardinale

programme.desc: An unknown enemy steals a new sleeping gas and unleashes it over London, leaving the citys banks and jewellery shops vulnerable to looting. Espionage adventure, starring Patrick Macnee, Gareth Hunt and Joanna Lumley

programme.title: Shooter
programme.desc: A former Marine sniper is coaxed back into action when government officials need his help to prevent an assassination attempt on the US president. However, the intended target is in fact an African archbishop, and the marksman is set up by double-crossing agents to take the fall, forcing him to go on the run as he fights to clear his name. Action thriller, with Mark Wahlberg, Michael Pena and Danny Glover

Unimpressed by the response from the professionals, Hannah takes matters into her own hands and turns amateur sleuth to solve the crime herself. Mystery, starring Alison Sweeney

programme.title: Family Guy

programme.title: Gwed

programme.desc: Gray tries to convince Katie to keep the baby, and uses bad news from the police in a bid to persuade her. Jack considers an offer on Annies cottage, leaving Diane devastated.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Liam loses his cool when Carla arrives late at the factory and accuses her of sleeping with Tony. Roy and Hayley take a break to sort things out, while Becky confronts Christian.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Liam struggles with his feelings for Carla, who warns him not to make a move on her again. Sarah refuses to work with David, and Molly backs up Tyrone in his fight against Paul.

programme.title: Agatha Christies Poirot
programme.desc: Aircraft manufacturer Lord Mayfield hosts a party to trap a woman suspected of being a spy for the Germans. programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Dr Weatherill and Sister Brigid take the Ormerod children on a family day out to Peasholm Park to see a naval re-enactment show, but the trip ends in disaster. Meanwhile, Dr Ellis risks getting too involved with a patient who is in trouble with the law, and Lizzie sets out to improve her career prospects. Starring Amy Robbins, Linda Armstrong, Neil McDermott and Michelle Hardwick

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Vernon buys a batch of topsoil for his new compost-producing business, little suspecting it is from a contaminated landfill site. The shady dealer who sold him the soil winds up dead - as do a number of local cows - and Vernon is soon fighting for his life. Elsewhere, seductive sergeant Nokes sets her sights on Steve Crane, and Bellamy wonders whether Gina will return to Aidensfield and marry him. Geoffrey Hughes, James Carlton and Mark Jordon star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Bellamy chases joyriders tearing through Aidensfield and accidentally runs down Don Dibleys son during the pursuit. The boys father demands compensation, but soon realises his problems have just begun as his daughter reveals she is pregnant. Steve finds himself in trouble and David invents a novel way to rid the estate of moles. Rural drama, starring Mark Jordon, James Carlton and Ted Robbins

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Nicola and Davids plans are disrupted with the news of Donalds recovery. Gray drowns his sorrows at the pub with Diane and cant resist making a pass at Paul when they are alone together.

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Donald continues his scheme as David resents Nicola visiting her husband and is even more upset when she reveals what she has to do in order to get his money and Jimmy visits his fathers grave and makes a shocking discovery.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Liam and Carla struggle with their feelings as they play a game of one-upmanship, Jason loses his cool and pins David against the wall and Frank makes Cilla a tempting offer.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: David feels disheartened after his run-in with Jason, but Gail begins to feel sympathy for him. Liam cant shrug off his feelings for Carla, and Lloyd asks Jodie out on a date.

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Berties circumstances change suddenly, leaving Edith uncertain whether to risk telling him the truth or keep her past a secret at all costs. Mary wonders if she can ever make peace with her sister as hostilities escalate, Spratt shows some hidden talents and Molesleys first day as a teacher does not go according to plan. Mrs Patmores bed and breakfast attracts unwanted attention, leaving her in need of the Crawleys help

programme.title: Dame Maggie Smith - A Celebration
programme.desc: A special tribute to the enigmatic actress Maggie Smith - discover her life story, told by the people who knew her best, and celebrate her much-loved appearances.

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A recently widowed woman arrives in Aidensfield wanting to bury her husband in the family grave, but the deceaseds brother refuses to co-operate because of an old feud. Vernon and David get involved and find themselves held at gunpoint as a shocking case of fraud is uncovered. Rural drama, starring Geoffrey Hughes and David Lonsdale

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Gina Ward makes a surprise return to Aidensfield and Bellamy encounters a key informant who might come in useful - but finds himself in trouble when the man disappears before he can offer a tip-off about an imminent armed robbery. Meanwhile, Vernon acquires a bargain miniature railway which he hopes will impress the new estate manager, and it emerges Dr Liz Merrick may have feelings for Lord Ashfordlys recently appointed land agent. Tricia Penrose, Mark Jordon and Geoffrey Hughes star

programme.title: Rosemary and Thyme
programme.desc: The duo are hired to investigate why newly planted roses at an upmarket preparatory school keep dying. After witnessing the arcane ritual of the Night of the Stag, they detect tensions between modernising headmaster Quentin Marshall and established members of his staff who are harbouring secrets someone is prepared to kill for. Drama, guest starring Anthony Andrews (Brideshead Revisited), with Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Its the day of the Little Crosby Folk Festival and organiser Toby Winning is found dead, having drowned in a bowl of eggs and live eels. The murder seems to have been inspired by a ballad made famous by the late, lamented star Johnny Carver. Then it comes to light the victim recently announced plans to move the event to a new location, which would have cost local entrepreneur Frank Wainwright dearly. Tobys estranged wife Alice also comes under suspicion, before two further killings take place, echoing more lyrics from the song

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: The detective discovers his favourite 1970s band are on the verge of a comeback - along with their singer Esme Ford, who has made a shocking reappearance from beyond the grave, having faked her own death 35 years earlier. programme.desc: The last small-screen episode, catching up with the Abbeys residents at the tail-end of 1925. Mary endeavours to build bridges, but Ediths secret continues to pose a threat. programme.title: Chateau DIY

Meanwhile, at Château de Cezerac, Jon and Carmen are creating their dream bathroom

programme.title: The Great House Giveaway
programme.desc: In Co Durham, Steph and Alex transform a redbrick terrace into a first-time buyers dream. However, a simple flip becomes a full renovation as the plaster comes off the wall

programme.title: The Great House Giveaway

It was converted into two flats, but now the boys decide to turn it back into a period family home. However, to achieve top-notch in a nice part of town, the finish has to be perfect. With very little outside help, can they get the house over the line before times up?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Property expert Danni Menzies arrives in the beautiful coastal town of Nerja in southern Spain to meet house-hunter Frances, who is dreaming of buying a holiday home she can enjoy with her friends and family. With her daughter Karina also on hand to lend her support, Frances would love to find a two-bed property close to the sea, so Danni sets out to deliver her dream within a budget of £200,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Having recently sold their business in Edinburgh, Gary and Kim Harrison cannot wait to find their dream holiday home on their favourite Caribbean island of St Lucia to enjoy their retirement. With a budget of £300,000, Danni Menzies delivers five properties with stunning views, but which one - if any - will steal their hearts and prompt them to make an offer?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dressage champion Natasha Baker is the first of five Paralympic athletes hosting dinner parties, serving up an evening of home-cooked food and old-fashioned family entertainment to judoka Chris Skelley, sports presenter Arthur Williams, wheelchair basketball player Amy Conroy and retired swimmer Liz Johnson

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Paralympic judoka Chris Skelley gets to grips with the pots and pans on the second night of the dinner party challenge. Wheelchair basketball star Amy Conroy is confused by his menu, although retired swimmer Liz Johnson is impressed with the starter. The entire group are all blown away by Chriss motivation for a medal in Tokyo, while his karaoke performance is memorable for entirely different reasons

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hopes are high for Paralympic presenter Arthur Williams as he serves up an international menu - fondue from Switzerland, nasi goreng from the Far East and apple crumble from the UK

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Wheelchair basketball star Amy Conroy fears that her simple menu is not going to be enough to grab the £1,000 prize, so ups the ante with a night fit for historical heroes. Its a fun evening as Amy welcomes her guests dressed as Cleopatra and first through the door is Arthur as Einstein, followed by Chris claiming to be Julius Caesar. Bringing a bit of style to the evening is Natasha, who comes as Audrey Hepburn, and finally Liz, whos opted to come as a suffragette. Will Amys night of history and beer pong be enough to overcome a beige menu and clinch the cash?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The final host of the week is retired swimmer Liz Johnson, whos hoping that her menu of personal favourites will win her the £1,000 prize for charity. Without exception, Lizs guests embrace her onesie dress code, especially Chris who is bear-ly recognisable on arrival. Natasha isnt a fan of the fishy starter, but Arthur and Chris bond over her leftovers - a sight that touches the heart strings of Amy. The group swaps tales of previous games over paella and their competitive spirit is unleashed over a kazoo competition

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at Grove Barn BandB in Denton, Norfolk, where owners Steph and Alan Flight hope that their approach to cleanliness will lead to good feedback from their guests. However, visitors Scott and Alistair make a discovery in the bathroom that leaves them with a sinking feeling. And theres confusion in the kitchen at breakfast time

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second episode comes from Picaroons in Sheringham, Norfolk, where problems with the plumbing and a disastrous breakfast lead to harsh words between the hosts and their guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at Brightham House in Malborough, Devon, where couple Scott Browning and Alastair Veness hope to impress their guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final stay is at Morans BandB in Westward Ho!, Devon, owned by ultra-chic retirees John and Jaqueline, although the lack of an en-suite does not impress Christine and Ian

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day of the competition sees the BandB owners meet for the last time to find out how much theyve been paid and to settle some scores. Grove Barn owners Steph and Alan have some hair-raising issues up for discussion after the cleaning critique they received

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets architect Iain and his wife Jenny, who intend to build an enormous black minimalist house right in the middle of a 19th-century Scottish country estate. Their grand vision also involves connecting the new rectangular block to a dilapidated gardeners bothy - and the neighbours are watching

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: In Bedfordshire, police detectives discover a connection between a major fraud on a vulnerable old mans life savings and a gang who are exploiting young people. As cameras follow every twist and turn of two very different types of police operations, the true extent of the damage that the drugs trade wreaks are exposed in the most surprising ways

programme.title: Night Coppers
programme.desc: Sergeants Sam and Ed are called to a gas leak at a petrol station, but one reveller from a nearby festival is not interested in respecting the rules. Zoe and Emma respond to a domestic dispute about some missing teeth and Sam helps a security guard whos been dealing with a disgruntled drunk person

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Chaos reigns in a hotel as one person is accused of assaulting another, and the police are called in while paramedics try to treat both parties at the same time. A trip over a pet dog leaves a woman with a wound on her arm that wont stop bleeding. Plus, a 76-year-old woman with fluctuating blood pressure confides in the paramedics that shes grieving the loss of her husband

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: In Bedfordshire, police detectives discover a connection between a major fraud on a vulnerable old mans life savings and a gang who are exploiting young people. As cameras follow every twist and turn of two very different types of police operations, the true extent of the damage that the drugs trade wreaks are exposed in the most surprising ways

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: The documentary following patients being treated at St Georges in south-west London reaches its 200th edition. Ky, 18, is brought in after being knocked off her motorbike in a hit-and-run, and her mum Sam is by her side as doctors assess the damage to her legs and pelvis. Aleks, 41, is suffering from confusion and memory loss after falling from her loft onto her head, and as her husband Paulo arrives at the hospital, medical staff are still unsure as to whether she has sustained permanent brain damage

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: Adam is brought in by ambulance after being involved in a high-speed motorcycle accident. The injured 20-year-old joined by his dad and sister. Meanwhile, Richard, aged 70, arrives at AandE with a high heart rate, and 10-year-old Pia is brought in by her mum after falling over and hurting her knee

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt reveals the sweet secret to iced writing on supermarket birthday cakes, and Jimmy Doherty jets to Japan to establish why soy is in so many of the UKs favourite foods, also learning how this little bean could be health-enhancing. Kate Quilton looks at the growing trend of hemp-based food products

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.sub-title: Escape to the Chateau at Christmas 2018
programme.desc: At the end of a busy year at Chateau de la Motte-Husson, Dick and Angel throw a Christmas party for everyone who helped them in restoring the property to its current glory. The festive menu includes produce from their own walled garden, as well as homemade wines, and the couple also put up a Christmas tree which, as usual, is on a spectacular scale

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: Local dignitaries are scheduled to unveil the art studio in the fairytale turret at Chateau de Bourneau, so owners Erin and JB desperately try to complete the renovations in time. In the Dordogne, Nick, Nicole and baby Noah have outgrown their basement gite, so work begins on the renovations of the main body of their chateau. In Normandy, Donna and Paul start installing the first of their 40 bespoke windows in their abandoned water mill. The question is, has Paul got his measurements right?

programme.title: The Great House Giveaway
programme.desc: Assistant accountant Danielle and architect Alessio transform a tiny period one-bedroom cottage in Castle Donington, Leicestershire, into a modern holiday let. With no kitchen and a very basic bathroom in the damp-ridden property, theres a lot to unearth, including a hidden vintage Victorian inglenook

programme.title: The Great House Giveaway
programme.desc: Glamour model Alaw and technical engineer Harri are paired up to transform a one-bed terrace in Aberoer, Wrexham, into a house that would attract a first-time buyer

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Lian and Dave are searching for a holiday home in Spains Almería Province to enjoy with their 13-year-old son Dominic. Ben Hillman lines up five impressive properties for their £80,000 budget, but will any of them be the perfect place?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Retired couple Stephen and Janis Pigeon have a budget of £150,000 to move to the western Costa del Sol. Having sold their Buckinghamshire home, the pressure is on for Jasmine Harman to find them a suitable place in the Spanish region reasonably quickly

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Travel manager and part-time comedian Rod hosts the first party from Sussex, serving up a comprehensive and complicated menu - but a surprising lack of jokes. His guests are cheese-mad charity manager Paula, sarcastic solicitor Hassan, eccentric jewellery entrepreneur Sarah and animal psychic Josie

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mystic and animal communicator Josie takes over the kitchen in Sussex, where her guests are shocked to discover her mystical knick-knacks, including Tarot cards and a broomstick

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Its the turn of food hub charity director Paula to host, who takes inspiration for her menu from her job, by using ingredients that have passed their best before date

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The fourth night in Sussex, finds vegan solicitor Hassan acting as host, incorporating his love of Asian food into his menu. With his first course of gyoza winning over ultra-critical guest Rod and the rest of the table, it looks like Hassan is on a winning streak. However, a huge error in spice judgement causes spice-phobe Paula to throw in the towel and even challenges the taste buds of heat-loving Sarah

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Serving up the last meal of the week in Sussex is jewellery entrepreneur Sarah, who hopes to scoop the grand with an evening of simple and nutritious food. Its an entertaining night with the group auditioning for a home shopping channel, one diner revealing their bovine secret and a cosmetic confession leaving everyone gobsmacked. As the evening draws to a close, a dodgy dessert throws the soiree off-track and there are tears at the table when the gang members assess their week together

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at BnB at 43 in Richmond, North Yorkshire, where Jenny and Johnny Hatch hope their guests will enjoy a home-from-home experience

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Dazzling decor and cleanliness concerns give guests opposing views of Sutton Park in Blackpool, before a breakfast buffet comes under scrutiny in the morning

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit this week, the group head to Edburton in West Sussex, and Tottington Manor, where owners Debra and Jamie Tombs claim to offer the Manor House experience

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final stay is at Flynns Pub and Guesthouse in Hackney, east London, run by friends Serena and Kelly, who pride themselves on having clean and stylish rooms

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: It is the final day and the BandB owners meet for the last time to settle some scores. Jenny and Johnny want to get to the bottom of the stain on Kelly and Serenas stay

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets widowed teacher Gretta, who is making a fresh start in rural Cambridgeshire with a Malaysian-inspired burnt wood and glass home being designed by her nephew Carlos and project managed by her brother-in-law Fernando - despite his lack of building experience. However, as site clearance begins, so does the Covid-19 pandemic - and family harmony is tested when an apple tree much loved by Fernando is condemned for removal by Gretta

programme.title: Our Farm Next Door: Amanda, Clive and Kids
programme.desc: Amanda Owen and her family continue the task of turning an abandoned farmhouse into a 21st-century home. Its summer in Swaledale and the renovation of Anty Johns is about to hit its one-year anniversary, with plenty of work still to do for Richard the builder and the Owen family. For the kids, the summer holidays mean picnics and playing in the stream, but dad Clive is laid low by a hip operation

programme.title: Our Tiny Islands
programme.desc: Exploring some of the UKs smaller islands, as well as the wildlife and communities that inhabit them. This edition takes a look at the Isle of Gigha, where Tony and Catriona have settled and set themselves up as oyster farmers. Plus, cameras follow French-born Marie, who works as a fire officer at the tiny airport on the Scottish island of Fair Isle

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: A motorcyclist collides with a deer. Luckily for the patient, an orthopaedic surgeon stops to help. A woman driving to work is forced to pull over and call 999 after experiencing heart palpitations. A young man is constantly being sick and needs to go to hospital. A bike ride ends with a bruised bottom the likes of which the paramedics have never seen before, and after seven weeks with an infection an asthma patient is still struggling to breathe

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: The air ambulance crews race to help a teenage motorcyclist who has been hit by a car and catapulted into the air - suffering multiple fractures to his legs and arms. On holiday in Cumbria, a man collapses while working out and his stepdaughter performs CPR to try to keep him alive. A driver suffers a nasty leg wound after being hit from behind on the M40 - and to make matters worse, he is trapped in his lorry

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: Leon, 36, is airlifted to St Georges after being involved in a head-on collision with a car, while rugby player Graham, 37, is treated after clashing with another player, and has lost feeling in his arms and legs. Plus, four-year-old Elliott has come to AandE with his mum after getting a foreign object stuck up his nose

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the experts return to hear the stories of more treasured items before bringing them back to life for their owners. Horologist Steve Fletcher gets his hands on the largest timepiece he has ever attempted to restore in the barn, a one-of-a-kind clock built by the owners father for a display at the World Trade Centre in Dallas. The other items are an Austin J40 toy pedal car, a china dog complete with its own wooden kennel and a lucky cap belonging to an avid Rotherham United fan

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Bookbinder Chris Shaw needs all his skills when he is presented with a Jewish prayer book that originally belonged to the owners Austrian grandparents, and was kept by them throughout their time at Theresienstadt concentration camp in the Czech Republic. Mark Stuckey tries to get a sound from an ageing and very damaged radio, and also teams up with upholsterer Sonnaz Nooranvary to work on a 1970s egg-shaped chair with enclosed speakers. Plus, owner Ramzi Al-Nayazi brings in a treasured horse racing game from his childhood in Iraq

programme.title: Money for Nothing

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell tell more stories of people desperate to find missing family and answer questions that have haunted entire lives. programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a Victorian folly in Devon, where some ghoulish buys shock his wife. Plus, premium prices at an antique emporium in London cause trouble

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
