programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade is joined by comedian Lou Sanders for a two-day break in the Norwegian city of Bergen, taking a speedboat transfer from the airport to their waterfront lodgings. They explore the historic neighbourhood of Bryggen, ride a cable car to the top of Mt Ulriken and fly down the fastest zipline in Norway - against Richards better judgement

programme.title: James May at the Edge of Space
programme.desc: James undergoes rigorous training at a US Air Force base in California before boarding a U-2 spy plane for a flight that will take him 70,000ft above Earth. Along the way he has to learn how to eject from his cockpit in an emergency, how to survive the 13-mile fall back to terra firma and how to wear a space suit worth $250,000

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Packages of cocaine are found concealed in the chassis of a bus, officers receive a tip-off about a vehicle loaded with cartel cash, and a magician comes under scrutiny

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: A shipment of cocaine is discovered in the fifth wheel of a tractor-trailer, and officers searching a courier van find a cache of firearms

programme.title: Speed with Guy Martin
programme.desc: The motorcycle racer and lorry mechanic attempts, with the aid of slipstreaming, to break the British record for outright speed on a bicycle - 110mph. Guy recruits a team comprising a truck racer, a bike builder and a design engineer to prepare for the feat, and undergoes a training regime with double Olympic cycling gold medallist Laura Trott before heading to Pendine Sands on the shores of Carmarthen Bay for his challenge

programme.title: Speed with Guy Martin
programme.desc: For his second adrenaline-fuelled challenge, the racer tries to set the world record for riding a motorcycle on water. With the help of a Cambridge professor and a team of marine engineers, he attempts the feat at Bala Lake in Snowdonia, with extra fittings on his bike that should enable it to skim across the surface. Crashing is inevitable, so Guy endures a rigorous training schedule to prepare himself for the task

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Customs and Border Protection officers think they have spotted a trend when they seize drugs from behind the dashboards of two cars. A Mexican woman asks officers for protection

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers in Hidalgo are forced to close the bridge when its stormed by dozens of asylum seekers trying to jump the queue of people waiting to seek refuge in the USA

programme.title: Train Rescue Down Under
programme.desc: A freight train needs an urgent engine replacement after a critical failure, and a crew works on a complex bogie change for a 132 T locomotive

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff, Chris Harris and Paddy McGuinness head on an icy expedition across the wild Scottish Highlands in the new Land Rover Defender, Mercedes G-Wagen and Ariel Nomad to see which vehicle will prove itself the ultimate off-roader

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff, Chris Harris and Paddy McGuinness confront the male mid-life crisis by buying the perfect sports cars for a middle-aged gentleman. Back at the track, Chris tests out the raucous new Toyota GR Yaris hot hatch

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore Britains fondness for picnics, preparing an alfresco lunch at Beaufort Polo Club in the Cotswolds. They also discover how the habit of outdoor dining in summer evolved into its current form, celebrate snacks such as Cornish pasties and Scotch eggs, and bake a Dundee cake

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall
programme.desc: In the town of Looe, Rick discovers a time when the Cornish were taken as slaves by Barbary Pirates. He joins one of the last fishing boats in St Mawes and uses the catch of lemon sole to make a delicious warm salad. In Newlyn, he meets two entrepreneur chefs who are cooking mackerel to perfection

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick explores the Rame Peninsula. Far from the traditional tourist track, this part of Cornwall is famed for its cliffs and beaches. Its also where he meets a beachcomber who has found some remarkable objects washed up on the shore

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rapper MIST, comedian Jayde Adams, interior designer Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen and former Paralympian swimmer Ellie Simmonds join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Richard Osmans House of Games
programme.desc: Former winners Maisie Adam, Ivo Graham, Dev Griffin and Zoe Lyons test their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Richard Osmans House of Games
programme.desc: Former winners Angela Barnes, Kemah Bob, Ade Edmondson and Beattie Edmondson test their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Lorraine Kelly hosts an extended episode of the current affairs quiz, with team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton joined by comedian Maisie Adam and journalist Matt Chorley

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition of the comedy panel game, in which the united-related questions are so difficult, points are awarded for interesting - but not necessarily correct - answers. Nabil Abdulrashid, Bill Bailey, Victoria Coren Mitchell and Alan Davies take part, while Sandi Toksvig hosts

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson are joined by jazz singer Jamie Cullum, Desert Island Discs presenter Kirsty Young and stand-up stars Joe Wilkinson and Katherine Ryan to discuss and dissect events that set the British publics chins wagging. Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain presents a special compilation show featuring previously unbroadcast material, out-takes and favourite bits from series 12 of the satirical comedy quiz shown in 2013. With regular panellists Chris Addison, Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? at Christmas
programme.desc: Jo Brand, Joe Lycett, Joe Swash and Ruth Madeley join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for this festive edition of the comedy game show. Did one of the panellists really program a satnav so their mothers trip to Lakeside ended up in the Lake District? And would one of the captains really hold up a train to get his daughters cuddly toy back? Or were they just festive fibs? Rob Brydon hosts the fun

Along the way, he experiences zero gravity under test conditions, endures the gravitational forces of a shuttle launch in a centrifuge chamber, and flies to the edge of space in a U-2 spy plane

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: More stories from the documentary series that looks at the 28 bridges that cross the notorious Rio Grande, between Texas and Mexico, and provide a gateway for legitimate goods and a lucrative pipeline for illegal contraband, weapons and drugs. Officers in Eagle Pass seize over 15 kilograms of heroin and unveil a new cartel drug-smuggling tactic, and a Mexican family in Laredo makes a plea for humanitarian parole

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers hand over a convict to Mexican authorities in the middle of the Juarez Lincoln bridge, and a man drops a marijuana joint on a customs floor in Progreso

programme.title: Speed with Guy Martin
programme.desc: Speed freak Guy Martin embarks on a mission to fly using muscle power alone, by building the worlds fastest human-powered aircraft. He heads to Southampton University where, in 1961, Derek Piggot became the first man to fly under his own power. Guy teams up with a group of engineers from the same university to build a plane that Guy will ride like a bicycle - will he manage to fly into the record books?

programme.title: Speed with Guy Martin
programme.desc: The racing fan sets out to break the record for the worlds fastest gravity-powered sled, taking expert advice from Winter Olympic gold medallist Amy Williams. Guy experiences his first taste of going blisteringly fast on ice at the famous Cresta Run in the Swiss ski resort of St Moritz, before a crack team of engineers helps him build a prototype toboggan. Then its on to Andorra in the Pyrenees, where he hopes to steer himself into the record books on the new speed ski slope Pista Riberal

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: A 12-year-old boy turns up at one of the bridges on his own, claiming that his mother has been kidnapped by the cartels and he has been living on the streets

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers are on the lookout for day-trippers trying to smuggle prescription pills back into America, bought cheaply from one of the 200 pharmacies on the other side of the border

programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers prepare a selection of extravagant British gourmet dishes, using high-quality ingredients including lobster, truffles, prime cuts of meat and expensive chocolate. The duo also explore the stories behind the recipes

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef champions the food, history and culture of the county, foraging for mussels in his favourite rock pools, and touring Bodmin Moors dark past with his son Jack. He also cooks a fool-proof souffle with artisan Cornish goats cheese

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick makes heritage cider with Raynor Winn, author of The Salt Path, and cooks chicken, leek and cider gratin for his friend John Harris, the head gardener at Tresillian House, who regales Rick with his memories of cider-making as a boy. The chef also meets a sea shanty group with a difference

programme.desc: A smothered Chelsea makes a big decision about her future, but could it be a huge mistake? Meanwhile, Christian and Syed find unlikely allies in each other

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: A recently paroled convict takes his son to Jersey without telling the boys mother or his parole officer. Detective drama, starring John Nettles

programme.desc: Howard asks a reluctant Clegg to deliver a message to Marina at her place of employment. Meanwhile, Seymour goes in search of oil, but manages to drill through a water main. Comedy, starring Peter Sallis and Michael Aldridge

programme.desc: Seymour takes it upon himself to supervise repairs to a boat, and together with Clegg tries to persuade Compo to take up canoeing to improve his physique. Comedy, starring Michael Aldridge, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: While trying a man with an emotional age of 13 for murder, Deed causes outrage among his fellow judges by delving into a fraud case involving two solicitors. As they, Sir Ian Rochester and even his ex-father-in-law urge him not to get involved, Deed pushes harder for the truth

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Brian finds the library card of cold case victim Dr Richard Symes, leading the team to reinvestigate the death of the professor, who perished after falling from the roof of his college three years previously. Sandra and Gerry interview Symes widow, who believes principal Jeremy Ventham drove her husband to suicide following a conflict over teaching methods. Crime drama, starring Alun Armstrong and Amanda Redman

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.sub-title: In the Sight of the Lord: Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. A fourth body is discovered, dispatched with the killers trademark nail through the head. Boyds investigation leads him back to the Lindfield Regiment, and to a mysterious woman the latest victim was attempting to track down. In doing so, he uncovers a long-buried story of a gang rape that led to pregnancy and suicide. Trevor Eve and Sue Johnston star

programme.title: Hamish Macbeth

programme.desc: Tom fears his illegal actions will catch up with him when John Jo is dumped outside AandE, and Ric realises hes recently been operated on. Sandy finds romance with a patients nephew, and Lisa struggles to accept her fathers budding relationship with Kath

programme.desc: Deakin and Beech keep watch on a newly released kidnapper, hoping hell lead them straight to the whopping £300,000 ransom he and a crony were paid for the safe return of their last victim. programme.desc: A private meeting of European financiers attracts the attention of three criminals, who break into the venue to rob the delegates. Detective drama, guest starring Patrick Allen, with John Nettles and Terrence Alexander

programme.desc: Margaret tries to take Victors mind off his depressing situation by encouraging him to attend a fitness class and read a book on how to cope with old age. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Seymour reveals his latest invention - a purse for men. Compo agrees to test the product, which results in minor havoc. Comedy, with Bill Owen, Michael Aldridge and Peter Sallis

Crime drama, guest starring Adrian Schiller and Samantha Bond

programme.desc: A festive special of John Sullivans sitcom from 2006. Meanwhile, Beth is set for a Christmas surprise and Tyler spreads a rumour that Mrs Cakeworthy is pregnant - a revelation that comes as quite a shock to her husband, as they have not been intimate for some time. Nigel Harrison and Paul Bown guest star

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Its Christmas, a time of goodwill and cheer, but Del and Rodney are so sick of Grandads cooking and TV circuses that they put on their glad rags and have a festive night out at the Monte Carlo Club. However, an argument over the best romantic technique makes the pair forget their intentions, and the objects of their affections are whisked away from under their noses. Festive edition of the comedy from 1981, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Christmas proves a depressing time for Del-Boy as he tries to get over another failed romance, but he soon bounces back after finding a new lady friend. The problem is she also has a son. Christmas special from 1982, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del and Rodneys Christmas celebrations are disrupted by the unexpected arrival of their estranged father - leaving the brothers doubtful they can trust him after such a long absence. Another chance to see the 1983 festive special of John Sullivans comedy

programme.desc: Festive special from 1978. Foggy films a video message to send to Noras ailing brother in Australia, so he can be reminded what a traditional British Christmas is like. Brian Wilde and Kathy Staff star

programme.desc: Del and Rodneys Christmas celebrations are disrupted by the unexpected arrival of their estranged father - leaving the brothers doubtful they can trust him after such a long absence. Another chance to see the 1983 festive special of John Sullivans comedy

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.sub-title: Christmas Special 1991: The Father Christmas Suit

Festive special from 1991, starring Patricia Routledge, Clive Swift and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: A festive special of John Sullivans sitcom from 2006. Jed, Elgin and Bryan become convinced a mythical creature is stalking Winterdown Farm, and Llewellyn accuses the Boyces dog of seducing his pedigree collie. Meanwhile, Beth is set for a Christmas surprise and Tyler spreads a rumour that Mrs Cakeworthy is pregnant - a revelation that comes as quite a shock to her husband, as they have not been intimate for some time. Nigel Harrison and Paul Bown guest star

programme.title: Dads Army
programme.desc: Pompous Captain Mainwaring proves he is a softie at heart by organising a turkey dinner as a Christmas treat for the struggling senior citizens of Walmington-on-Sea. Festive episode from 1974, starring Arthur Lowe, John Le Mesurier and John Laurie

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: On Christmas Eve, the Wests join the Shipmans for one of Micks famous turkey dinners. Smithy can hardly wait to spend his first yuletide with baby Neil, but fails to realise Dave will be tagging along and playing happy families with Nessa. Meanwhile, Gavin and Stacey make an announcement that does not exactly fill their friends and relatives with joy, and Bryn has a heart-to-heart with Jason. Festive edition of the comedy from 2008, starring Mathew Horne and Joanna Page

programme.title: Men Behaving Badly
programme.desc: Tony and Garys gleeful anticipation of Christmas soon gives way to disappointment and comatose oblivion in front of the telly, and a glimpse of how respectable married life might have been with Deborah and Dorothy only underlines what a terrible time they are having. Festive special from 1997, starring Martin Clunes, Neil Morrissey, Caroline Quentin and Leslie Ash

programme.desc: The pals look forward to celebrating Christmas, but an unexpected guest disrupts their plans as Richie suffers delusions of grandeur and the whole spirit of the festive season is jeopardised. Anarchic comedy, starring Adrian Edmondson and Rik Mayall

When he is visited by the Spirit of Christmas, he gains an insight into the dastardly deeds of his ancestors, and starts to wonder if he would be better off following in their footsteps. Comic reversal of the classic Dickens tale, starring Rowan Atkinson, Tony Robinson, Stephen Fry, Hugh Laurie, Robbie Coltrane and Miranda Richardson

programme.desc: Lee wants to spend time alone with Lucy at Christmas, but the unexpected arrival of Tim, Daisy and assorted relatives threatens his plans. programme.title: The Royle Family
programme.desc: With the family stuffed full of turkey and Nana supping snowballs like theres no tomorrow, it can mean only one thing - Christmas at the Royles, who are celebrating in typical fashion by congregating round the TV. programme.title: Nick Knowles Big House Clearout
programme.desc: The presenter helps more families who are being crushed by their clutter. He begins in Portsmouth, where three generations are squeezed together in a three-bed semi thats bursting at the seams in an extraordinary challenge full of emotion and memories. When Sarahs husband Trevor suddenly passed away, she had to return from Dubai to her old house - in which her daughter Stevie and five-year-old grand-daughter were living. Coping with grief, Sarah was unable to face sorting through a lifetime of belongings, so for a year, the house has been totally packed with clutter from the attic to the outhouses, and its become the way they live

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: Drew and Jonathan aim to create a modern, spacious home from a choppy layout that is no longer functional for four adults living under one roof.

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: Drew and Jonathan update the awkward floor plan of a single-story house with some 1970s quirks for two high school sweethearts who have moved 14 times in 15 years

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team meet Rob and Michelle Wall and their son Noah. The couple live in a small 18th-century house in Cumbria, which is currently a half-finished renovation project that had to be put on hold when Noah was born with spina bifida. Designer Charlie Luxton is tasked with making the cold and unsafe property a special haven for the family - and as always an army of local tradesmen turn out in force to help make the dream a reality

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles meets Hereford couple Colin and Clare Gibbons, whose life together fell apart in 2012 when their eldest son Christopher was diagnosed with Duchenne muscular dystrophy, one of the most severe forms of the condition. Despite having a lovely house, it needs adapting to Christophers needs for both now and in the future, so the DIY SOS team - bolstered by dozens of local tradespeople - descend on the property to add a two-storey extension, with designer Julia Kendell on hand to ensure they stick to her vision while adding a few finishing touches of her own

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Two years ago, Michelle and Rod Malone set about adapting their home after daughter Maddie contracted a rare brain disease that left her struggling to walk and talk. However, unforeseen problems with the project left them living in just a couple of rooms in an unsafe house. Enter Nick Knowles and the DIY SOS builders, bolstered by an army of local tradespeople, to complete what the Malones started and give it a few finishing touches, courtesy of flamboyant designer Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen

programme.sub-title: Hugo and the Ice Cream Pups
programme.desc: Pete meets some newborn pups fighting to survive, and helps teach Hugo, a Cane Corso rescued from quarantine at Dover, how to be a dog

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel diagnoses the joint condition osteochondritis dissecans in a hyperactive ridgeback named Loki, and discusses treatment options with his owners. Newfoundland Hugo is referred for his hip dysplasia, but Noel discovers issues with his elbow and knee joints, while Carol and Nigel bring their mischievous seven-month-old Havana kitten Zahra following a mysterious accident at home, which resulted in a broken leg

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: An energetic one-year-old bull terrier puppy called Apple comes into the surgery with an ankle problem, and Noel hopes a custom-made, 3D-printed implant may give this beloved pet a new lease of life. He also treats a two-year-old Siamese cat with a broken leg, shattered pelvis and suspected spinal injury after being hit by a van, while four-year-old collie cross Rosco is tested for hip dysplasia

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Three more sets of parents-to-be arrive at Liverpool Womens Hospital to welcome new additions to their families, including 29-year-old Kate and her 32-year-old husband Pete, whose short-term memory was damaged following a hard-fought battle against meningitis and encephalitis 10 years earlier. The pair hope Petes brain injury will not stop him from being able to recall this memorable moment in the future. Also featured is third-time mother Lisa, whose previous two labours only lasted six and four hours respectively, and former drama school student Hayley, who already has children with her other-half Stephen, and has resolved to appreciate every moment with her family after losing her own mother at an early age

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The midwives of Liverpool Womens Hospital invite viewers into the delivery suites one last time, introducing 27-year-old Gina and her partner James. The pair met at university, while Gina was on an exchange programme from Shanghai, and made their long-distance relationship work by chatting through cuddly toys via the internet. However, they must now demonstrate their maturity and become parents. Meanwhile, self-confessed baby machine Margy arrives expecting her fifth child, and childhood sweethearts Craig and Sarah, who faced parenthood at an early age, look forward to taking their next baby back to their own home rather than to their parents

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Janine and Adam assist a woman who is threatening to jump out of a first-floor window, and husband and wife team Ann and Kevin are called out to help Anns sick Dad

programme.title: Hungry for It
programme.desc: Ten rookie cooks take the ultimate crash course for how to make it in the food business, guided by their mentors Big Zuu and Kayla Greer. Stacey Dooley presents. The cooks create levelled-up party food and dish up burgers to 100 hungry diners

programme.title: Nick Knowles Big House Clearout
programme.desc: The presenter heads to the former mill town of Bolton in Greater Manchester to meet a family in a four-bedroom semi overwhelmed by clutter. Nicks team empty their home and transfer 195 boxes of possessions to the Albert Halls in Bolton before creating a sensational makeover

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles travels to Orpington, south-east London, to meet hospital worker Jason Sulong, who was involved in a motorcycle accident that left him partially paralysed. Now he is unable to climb the stairs in his home and has difficulty accessing his bathroom and washing facilities, so designer Gabrielle Blackman teams up with the DIY SOS builders and other members of the local community to work to adapt his home to his needs over the course of just nine days

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles travels to Basildon, Essex, to meet nine-year-old Brandon, who suffers a severe form of epilepsy and can have up to 30 seizures a day. He requires 24-hour care and mum Jenny cant let him out of her sight for a moment - and to make matters worse, the family home simply isnt safe enough for the youngster. Luckily, the local tradesmen have heard of the familys plight and arrive in force to help Nick and the team transform the home, with designer Naomi Cleaver on hand to ensure they dont stray too far from her vision

Now he is forced to sleep in a hospital bed in his kitchen - but it wont be for much longer, as his old workmates team up with the DIY SOS builders and other members of the local community to adapt his home to his needs, with designer Charlie Luxton on hand to keep the boys in check

programme.desc: Pete helps a withdrawn pregnant Malinois regain strength so she can care for her 11 lively pups, and falls for Winter, a Staffie who is covered in scars

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Childhood sweethearts Alyshea and Maculay worry about the welfare of their premature baby, who was born with lung problems and susceptible to infection and has been carefully monitored at Liverpool Womens Hospital. Samantha and Paul didnt have a chance to enjoy the birth of their first baby due to a complication during delivery, but their nerves are not helped by ending up in the same room on almost the same date. Meanwhile, Kevin and Emma are looking forward to becoming parents, after being forced to postpone their wedding and exotic travels plans

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Rhiannon, who has cystic fibrosis, prepares to risk her life to have a third child, while an unexpected turn of events during labour means Kirsty and her partner, retired soldier Ian, must alter their birth plan. Plus, single mum SammiJo relies on her mum to help her bond with her second baby in a way she couldnt when her first child was born

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: Paramedics discover things are not what they seem at a basketball game in Sydneys inner west, and a team provides critical relief at the scene of a scooter accident

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: Responders deliver a baby, attend to a four-year-old boy with a life-threatening heart condition, and navigate a mysterious cardiac episode in a cemetery

programme.title: Hungry for It

programme.title: Joanna Lumleys India
programme.desc: Joannas adventures across India conclude as she explores Rajasthan, Delhi and the mountainous North West, before ending in Kashmir, the place of her birth. Her first stop takes her to the Ranthambhore National Park, where she learns about the Wildlife Protection Society of Indias tiger conservation programmes. Joannas next stop takes her to the city of Delhi, where she begins her exploration of the capital at Humayuns Tomb, before ending her 5000 mile journey in Srinagar in Kashmi, the place where she was born

programme.title: Joanna Lumleys Japan
programme.desc: Joanna begins a 2,000-mile journey across Japan in Hokkaido, where she meets one of the most important animals in Japanese culture, the red-crowned crane. She arrives in Sapporo during the middle of the annual Snow Festival and meets members of the local indigenous community, before travelling into the Fukushima exclusion zone and taking a bullet train from Nagano to Tokyo

programme.title: Joanna Lumleys Japan
programme.desc: The actress flies over Tokyo in a helicopter. The city was bombed extensively during the Second World War, so almost all of it is a symbol of the post-war economic boom that saw Japan become the worlds second largest economy. While in the capital, Joanna heads out to a nightclub to see a Japanese girl band and witnesses the largely male audience perform almost as much as the artists on stage. Later, Joanna travels to the Kiso Valley to walk the Nakasendo Way, an ancient route that once linked Tokyo to Kyoto, a place best known for that most famous of Japanese traditions, the Geisha

programme.title: Joanna Lumleys Japan
programme.desc: The actress heads to the island of Shikoku hoping to gain a better understanding of Japanese Buddhism. She then takes a bullet train to another island - Kyushu - where she finds the Henn Na Hotel, the worlds first robot hotel. At Nagasaki, she visits Shiroyama Elementary school, one of the only buildings to survive the atomic bomb dropped on the city in 1945. Joanna then travels to Sakurajima, one of the countrys most active volcanoes, before heading to the islands of Okinawa where one of the bloodiest battles of the Second World War was fought

programme.title: Finders Keepers
programme.desc: When Martin and Ashley embark on a metal detecting trip in the fields of a farm they find a hoard of buried Saxon treasure worth millions. They must deal with the dilemma of declaring it or selling it privately with the help of Ashleys ex-con friend. Drama, starring Neil Morrissey, James Buckley and Fay Ripley

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Gina Ward makes a surprise return to Aidensfield and Bellamy encounters a key informant who might come in useful - but finds himself in trouble when the man disappears before he can offer a tip-off about an imminent armed robbery. Meanwhile, Vernon acquires a bargain miniature railway which he hopes will impress the new estate manager, and it emerges Dr Liz Merrick may have feelings for Lord Ashfordlys recently appointed land agent. Tricia Penrose, Mark Jordon and Geoffrey Hughes star

programme.desc: Oxfords last-surviving all-female college is holding a reunion to bid farewell to one of its most prominent professors. However, the evening leads to tragedy when a guest is found murdered, and Lewis is convinced the killing is connected to an attack that occurred at the same institution 10 years previously. The detective calls in his former DS, Alison McLennan, to help with the investigation, but the case takes a twist when two more bodies turn up. Crime drama, guest starring Juliet Stevenson and Saskia Reeves, with Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox

programme.desc: A cleaner is found dead in her home and suspicion immediately falls upon her lodger, who is arrested and convicted of her murder. It appears to be an open-and-shut case, but Superintendent Spence begins to question the mans guilt and invites Poirot to help uncover the identity of the real killer. The Belgian sleuth teams up with crime writer Ariadne Oliver (My Familys Zoe Wanamaker) as he tries to crack the case. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with Richard Hope, Joe Absolom, Amanda Root, Sian Phillips and Raquel Cassidy

programme.desc: Chaos reigns after an unknown sniper shoots a woman as she leaves a meeting of the flower show committee. DS Rachel Dawsons enquiries reveal the gunman may have missed his intended target - and when Blaketon spots an article in the local paper, he realises the bullet might have been aimed at him. Meanwhile, Peggy buys an ice-cream van to take advantage of the hot weather, but makes the mistake of leaving David in charge of the project. Lindsey Coulson guests alongside Derek Fowlds and Clare Wille

Ross and Zacky discover there is a fever at Bodmin Jail just weeks before Jim is due to be released, so Ross embarks on a desperate course of action to save his friend - making things awkward when he is later invited to a grand ball, where in his frustration he gets fighting drunk, leaving Demelza to fend for herself

With Jonathan Kerrigan, Gwen Taylor, Vanessa Hehir and Andrew Langtree

programme.desc: The detective investigates the mysterious death of businessman John Shearwood, found floating in the water under the Gateshead Millennium Bridge when he was supposed to be on a golfing trip to Ireland. The mans wife Stella and brother Luke are baffled to discover he was working as an informant for HM Revenue and Customs. Chief Revenue investigator Owen Preece (guest star Robert Glenister) reveals Johns business manager Mark Donovan has been running an alcohol scam through their haulage firm and the deceased had agreed to offer information in exchange for immunity from prosecution. Was his cover blown? Owen doesnt think so, and Mark has an alibi - unlike Johns wife. Brenda Blethyn stars, with David Leon as her trusty sidekick Joe
